hero.title: Gemini 3 & 3.0 Guide Hub

hero.description: Gemini Studio is an English hub focused on Gemini 3 and Gemini 3.0. Explore capabilities, API concepts, prompt engineering techniques, and image generation workflowsâ€”then route high-intent image tasks to a simple browser-based tool at gempix2.site.

branding.title: ShipAny is built on the shoulders of giants

introduce.name: introduce
introduce.title: What is Gemini 3?
introduce.label: Introduction
introduce.description: Gemini 3 is Google's latest generation of the Gemini family: a multimodal model that can work with text, images, code and long documents in a single context. "Gemini 3.0" refers to the wave of models released in this generation, with variants tuned for different latency and deployment needs.

items.title: Multimodal by design
items.description: Gemini 3 can read and reason over text, images and other data types together, making it useful for research, debugging and creative workflows.

items.title: Long-context reasoning
items.description: Built on the long-context work from Gemini 1.5, Gemini 3 is designed to keep answers grounded across large documents, codebases and transcripts.

items.title: Tool-aware workflows
items.description: In many real apps, Gemini 3 orchestrates work: planning, calling tools, and refining outputs â€” including routing prompts into external image generators such as gempix2.site.

benefit.name: benefit
benefit.title: Why Use Gemini 3 (and this site)
benefit.label: Benefits
benefit.description: Gemini Studio focuses on practical Gemini 3 and Gemini 3.0 usage: how to turn the models into real workflows instead of just chasing benchmark numbers.

items.title: Workflow-first guidance
items.description: Content is written for developers, creators and teams who want to apply Gemini 3 to concrete tasks like coding, analysis and creative work.

items.title: Reusable prompt patterns
items.description: We emphasise prompt templates and structures you can reuse across projects, not one-off screenshots of impressive answers.

items.title: Clear path to real tools
items.description: When you are ready to generate images, we point you to a Gemini-grade image generator so you can plug in the prompts from this site.

usage.name: usage
usage.title: How to Use This Site
usage.description: Use Gemini Studio as your entry point into Gemini 3 and Gemini 3.0 workflows.

items.title: Start with the Gemini 3 guides
items.description: Read the Gemini 3 and Gemini 3.0 pages to understand capabilities, limitations and typical use cases.

items.title: Learn prompt patterns
items.description: Explore the prompt engineering guide to see how to structure instructions and constraints for more reliable behaviour.

items.title: Explore image workflows
items.description: Use the image generation guide to connect Gemini 3 prompts to external image generators for production-quality visuals.

items.title: Reuse the prompt library
items.description: Browse the prompt library for ready-made templates you can customise and plug into your own Gemini 3 flows.

comparison.label: Generation Comparison
comparison.title: Gemini 3 vs Earlier Generations
comparison.description: A high-level look at how Gemini 3 improves on earlier Gemini releases in terms of reasoning, long-context handling and real-world workflows.
comparison.footer_note: * All performance metrics based on official advanced AI technology benchmarks

feature.name: feature
feature.title: Core Capabilities of Gemini 3
feature.description: A quick snapshot of the kinds of things Gemini 3 is designed to handle well.

items.title: Multimodal understanding
items.description: Reason over text, images and other data together to answer questions, review designs or debug screenshots.

items.title: Long-context analysis
items.description: Work across long documents, transcripts or repositories while keeping answers grounded in the relevant parts.

items.title: Code and tooling
items.description: Generate and review code, call tools and APIs, and help keep multi-step development workflows on track.

items.title: Structured reasoning
items.description: Follow instructions about plans, steps and constraints so you can build more reliable multi-step flows.

items.title: Knowledge integration
items.description: Combine long-context recall with external tools to keep answers up to date and well scoped.

items.title: Safety & control
items.description: Use system prompts and guardrails to steer behaviour, reduce unwanted outputs and keep apps aligned with your policies.

testimonial.name: testimonial
testimonial.label: Testimonial
testimonial.title: How People Use Gemini 3
testimonial.description: Examples of how different types of users think about Gemini 3 and sites like this one.

items.title: Sarah Chen
items.label: Frontend engineer
items.description: I use Gemini 3 for code reviews and quick refactors. Having a focused guide makes it easier to design prompts that fit our stack instead of guessing.

items.title: Michael Rodriguez
items.label: Content & video creator
items.description: Gemini 3 helps me brainstorm scripts and visual ideas. I grab prompt patterns from the library here, then plug them into my favourite image generator.

items.title: Emily Watson
items.label: Product lead
items.description: When we started prototyping with Gemini 3, this site gave the team a shared vocabulary for prompts, safety and workflows. It saved weeks of trial-and-error.

faq.name: faq
faq.label: FAQ
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Gemini 3
faq.description: Quick answers to a few common questions. For more, see the dedicated FAQ page.

items.title: Is this an official Gemini site?
items.description: No. Gemini Studio is an independent content hub focused on Gemini 3 and Gemini 3.0. It is not an official Google or Gemini property.

items.title: Can I call the Gemini 3 API directly from this site?
items.description: This site does not expose direct API access. Instead, it focuses on guides, comparisons and prompt patterns that you can apply in your own integrations.

items.title: Where should I start if I am new to Gemini?
items.description: Begin with the Gemini 3 and Gemini 3.0 guides, then read the prompt engineering and image generation guides. You can also browse the prompt library for ready-made templates.
